required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Health Effects of Small-sided Team Handball
clinical_study.official_title: The Physiological Health Effects of 12 Weeks of Small-sided Team Handball Training in Young Adult Women and Men

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the project was to examine the fitness and health effects of participation in recreational Team Handball for untrained 20-30 year old healthy men and women.

detailed_description.textblock:
Fitness and health effects of 12 weeks of recreational team handball in untrained adult men and women aged 20-30 years"
Adult men and women aged 20-30 years will be recruited to take part in a 12-week intervention with recreational team handball. Half of the participants are men (n=32), who are randomly assigned to a group playing recreational team handball (n=16) and an inactive control group (n=16). The women (n=40) are also divided and assigned to a group with regular participation in recreational team handball (n=20) and an inactive control group (n=20). The training sessions will be offered 2-3 times weekly for 70 minutes per session by a supervised trainer. The sessions involves an injury preventive warm-up and ball exercises for 15 minutes followed by recreational handball on small pitches such as 4 vs 4. A comprehensive testing protocol is conducted before and after the training period. The measurements includes body composition and bone mineralization, blood pressure, resting heart rate, fasting blood sugar, insulin, cholesterol and bone markers. In addition, a number of physical tests which involves fitness level (VO2max), intermittent work, muscle strength and balance will further be conducted. The testing takes place at the University of Copenhagen. The training sessions will also take place at the University of Copenhagen or in a handball club near the University. The study will be approved by the local ethical committee of Copenhagen.

primary_outcome.measure: VO2max - change is being assessed after 12 weeks of intervention
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and after 12 weeks of intervention
primary_outcome.description: VO2max (mL/kg/min) is a measure of the cardiorespiratory during a treadmill test

secondary_outcome.measure: Fat percentage - change is being assessed after 12 weeks of intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and after 12 weeks of intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of fat percentage (%) performed by a dual energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA scan)

secondary_outcome.measure: Muscle mass - change is being assessed after 12 weeks of intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and after 12 weeks of intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of muscle mass (kg) performed by a DXA scan

secondary_outcome.measure: Mineral bone density - change is being assessed after 12 weeks of intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and after 12 weeks of intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Mineral bone density (g/cm2) performed by a DXA scan

secondary_outcome.measure: Bone mass - change is being assessed after 12 weeks of intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and after 12 weeks of intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Bone mass (kg) performed by a DXA scan

other_outcome.measure: Strength: Isokinetic Maximal voluntary contraction (MVC) - change is being assessed after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.description: Isokinetic MVC (Nm) performed in a isokinetic dynamometer

other_outcome.measure: Strength: Isometric MVC - change is being assessed after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.description: Isometric MVC (Nm) performed in a isokinetic dynamometer

other_outcome.measure: Strength: Countermovement maximal jumps (CMJ) jump height - change is being assessed after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.description: CMJ jump height (cm) performed on a force plate

other_outcome.measure: Strength: CMJ jump height - change is being assessed after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.description: CMJ peak (W/kg) performed on a force plate

other_outcome.measure: Postural balance: Sway area - change is being assessed after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.description: Sway area (cm2) performed on a force plate

other_outcome.measure: Postural balance: Sway length - change is being assessed after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.description: Sway length (mm) performed on a force plate

other_outcome.measure: Citrate synthase (CS) activity - change is being assessed after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.description: Muscle biopsies were taken from the male subjects and analyzed for CS activity (ug/l)

other_outcome.measure: 3-hydroxyacyl-coenzyme A (CoA) dehydrogenase (HAD) activity - change is being assessed after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.description: Muscle biopsies were taken from the male subjects and analyzed for HAD activity (ug/l)

other_outcome.measure: Specific fibre type cross sectional area (CSA) - change is being assessed after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.description: Muscle biopsies were taken from the male subjects and analyzed for specific fibre type CSA (Î¼m2)

other_outcome.measure: Fiber type composition - change is being assessed after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.description: Muscle biopsies were taken from the male subjects and analyzed for fibre type composition (%)

other_outcome.measure: Capillaries (cap./fiber) - change is being assessed after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.description: Muscle biopsies were taken from the male subjects and analyzed for cap./fibre

other_outcome.measure: Capillaries (cap./mm2) - change is being assessed after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured before and after 12 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.description: Muscle biopsies were taken from the male subjects and analyzed for cap./mm2

arm_group.description: 4 groups are randomized for 12 weeks of intervention; 2 groups are active, 2 groups are inactive: *1 group of men playing recreational handball
4 groups are randomized for 12 weeks of intervention; 2 groups are active, 2 groups are inactive: *1 group of women playing recreational handball
4 groups are randomized for 12 weeks of intervention; 2 groups are active, 2 groups are inactive: *1 group of men continuing their normal lifestyle patterns
4 groups are randomized for 12 weeks of intervention; 2 groups are active, 2 groups are inactive: *1 group of women continuing their normal lifestyle patterns

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy women and men from 20-30 years old
- If women, a regular menstrual cycle length (25 to 32 days) with or without use of contraceptives.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known familiar diseases
- If been smoking for the last two years before recruitment
- If involved in any regular physical training two years before recruitment
- Women: a peak oxygen uptake (VO2peak) higher than 45 mL/min/kg
- Men: a peak oxygen uptake (VO2peak) higher than 51 mL/min/kg
